Author: Petr Viktorin <encukou@gmail.com>
Date:   2019-02-05 13:50:43 +0100

    test_serving: Use sys.executable, not 'python'
    
    This test failed on systems where the Python command is not called "python".
    Also, it could execute Python 2 when pytest is run under py3, or vice versa.

commit bd139894e4689a55428de755ac540cecf3df6856
Merge: eda35e52 8eddfcaa
Author: David Lord <davidism@gmail.com>
Date:   2018-12-31 12:41:50 -0700

    Merge pull request #1426 from pgjones/master
    
    Remove future with_statement imports

commit 8eddfcaa4f1262af0231d1f3378add249c0180ca
Author: pgjones <philip.graham.jones@googlemail.com>
Date:   2018-12-31 10:01:23 +0000

    Remove future with_statement imports
    
    ``with`` as a statement has been mandatory since Python 2.6, yet
    Werkzeug supports Python 2.7 as the minimal version. Therefore this is
    safe to remove and leads to clearer code.

Merge: 873415ee 85db7fb9

    Merge pull request #1416 from pallets/reload-module
    
    reloader uses "-m" instead of file if possible

commit 85db7fb9d743fe7b98bb35a0305be7b95ae1c1f7
Author: David Lord <davidism@gmail.com>
Date:   2018-12-08 14:20:07 -0800

    split windows and nix workarounds

16	19	werkzeug/_reloader.py

commit 94e1ebd70f9f6501b452e7c3b8e1c54bc0afa9ee
Author: David Lord <davidism@gmail.com>
Date:   2018-12-08 10:41:31 -0800

    reloader uses "-m" instead of file if possible
    
    Python replaces "-m module" with the path to the module file. But this
    causes the reloader to be called with the path instead of "-m". Calling
    Python with a file adds its directory to the path. Adding "werkzeug" to
    the path broke imports.

5	0	CHANGES.rst
41	13	werkzeug/_reloader.py

    rewrite test client redirect handling
    
    * EnvironBuilder can be initialized from an environ.
    * Redirect environ is initialized from initial environ.
    * Script root and path are correctly distinguished.
    * HEAD method is not changed to GET.
    * Headers are passed to new request for all codes.
    * Body and relevant headers are dropped except for 307 and 308.
    * EnvironBuilder sets content type and length headers from autodetection
    * Better error message when disallowing domain redirects.
    * Test client recognizes 308 code.
    * Add 308 to http codes.

16	0	CHANGES.rst
55	30	tests/test_test.py
1	0	werkzeug/http.py
121	45	werkzeug/test.py

commit 2a8c81653a239eb656a3a9ec53a1dc02f0cbd105
Merge: 4d30c235 fd6eb305
Author: David Lord <davidism@gmail.com>
Date:   2018-11-24 20:12:12 -0800

    Merge pull request #1342 from pgjones/master
    
    Redirect with a 308 rather than 301 in a specific case

commit fd6eb30574c1586c80a6de53602739d6f8c1c211
Author: pgjones <philip.graham.jones@googlemail.com>
Date:   2018-08-09 08:22:24 +0100

    Redirect with a 308 rather than 301
    
    With strict slashes enabled and the route defined with a trailing
    slash e.g. `/a/` a request to `/a` currently results in a 301 response
    to redirect to `/a/`. This is good for GET and HEAD requests, but
    problematic for other verbs as clients will typically treat a 301
    response as meaning redirect as a GET verb as noted in RFC 2616
    section-10.3.2 (RFC 2616 stated this was erroneous, and then RFC 7231
    allowed this behaviour). RFC 7538 later introduced a 308 code to work
    as 301 was originally intended. As 308 is now widely supported, 301
    can be changed to 308.

5	1	tests/test_routing.py
1	1	werkzeug/routing.py
4	4	werkzeug/utils.py

commit 962746d9a38935bf25d1cc81036906c402bc96ec
Merge: 38ec0b24 2ac855ef
Author: David Lord <davidism@gmail.com>
Date:   2018-11-22 04:26:23 -0800

    Merge pull request #1346 from pgjones/headers
    
    Unicodify the header name (key) as well as value

commit 2ac855ef2e9f5200550772dc8a28d993ef6bc00b
Author: pgjones <philip.graham.jones@googlemail.com>
Date:   2018-08-25 15:30:41 +0100

    Unicodify the header name (key) as well as value
    
    In Python 2 using a Headers object as so,
    
        h = Headers()
        h[b'X-Foo'] = b'something'
    
    gives
    
        X-Foo: something
    
    in the actual HTTP message, whereas in Python 3 it is
    
        b'X-Foo': something
    
    this is because only the value is currently unicodified. This change
    ensures the header name (key) is also unicodified as well therefore
    matching the Python 2 usage and the expected usage.
    
    This also removes a regression test for unicode header keys that is
    not required. It was recognised in flask#758 as resulting in a HTTP
    message containing,
    
        u'X-Foo': something
    
    however this behaviour was fixed in
    f3435a346d0d559d1c19bbfca3745476c4942124 introducing the test, broken
    in 6049a4ff3c5224bedd24cdb29a23a5f1a9c2bf43 and then comprehensively
    fixed in db00dfb41be37ff34e4014ee4a31d9abac8165e2. Therefore with the
    last commit and tests as added the regression test is not required.

3	0	CHANGES.rst

commit 315b78cd882a7c898a5e34bf58f9a7d5d42b0fc9
Author: David Lord <davidism@gmail.com>
Date:   2018-11-19 06:59:35 -0800

    add changelog for GH-1242

4	0	CHANGES.rst
8	4	werkzeug/_reloader.py

commit 5f4c97dfc7cc154fb5cc6d3fe612dd27361f0458
Author: Sam Parkinson <sam@sam.today>
Date:   2018-01-22 08:08:39 +1100

    Do not add python executable to executable scripts when reloading
    
    Sometimes, the file in `sys.argv[0]` may use an interpreter
    other than python.  For example; NixOs replaces `sys.argv[0]` to a
    wrapper shell script which changes the environment variables before
    running the main entrypoint.
    
    Currently, the reloader assumes that all scripts need the python
    interpreter appended their command line.  This patch changes that to
    check if the script is set as executable, and does not use the
    python command if it is.

9	2	werkzeug/_reloader.py

commit 759aa6836d3734ae8587656941185d4d6c947966
Author: Anthony Sottile <asottile@umich.edu>
Date:   2018-09-16 12:29:00 -0700

    Import abc classes from collections.abc
    
    Fixes warnings that look like this:
    
    ```
    werkzeug/datastructures.py:16: DeprecationWarning: Using or importing the ABCs from 'collections' instead of from 'collections.abc' is deprecated, and in 3.8 it will stop working
    ```
    
    You can replicate these warnings by running
    `python -Wonce -m werkzeug.datastructures`

commit baf20510cb1112b27dd659034980e295fb0b5563
Author: Max Goodman <c@chromakode.com>
Date:   2018-08-03 11:37:47 -0700

    Replace shared global _empty_stream with separate instances
    
    If a test closed the _empty_stream, subsequent requests could reuse this
    closed stream, causing request.get_data() and other methods to fail.

commit 816a1e9e3c358b43047cf284b82407161690fd76
Merge: 3e42aad6 4d72f8dd
Author: David Lord <davidism@gmail.com>
Date:   2018-07-29 07:05:41 -0700

    Merge pull request #1338 from pgjones/master
    
    Raise an error if query string has multiple definitions

commit 4d72f8dd4166522338f3e1c47c7639e34156747e
Author: pgjones <philip.graham.jones@googlemail.com>
Date:   2018-07-29 11:44:27 +0100

    Raise an error if query string has multiple definitions
    
    Previously to this commit if when creating an environ (i.e. for
    testing) a query string is defined in the path and as an argument the
    path-query-string would be ignored. This results in the path not
    matching any routes and hence an unexpected result. This commit fixes
    this issue by raising a ValueError if someone should do this.
    
    Raising ValueError is considered the correct approach as it is unclear
    which individual query string is the user's intention or if they
    should be combined.

5	0	tests/test_test.py
2	0	werkzeug/test.py

commit 5e2b8cd850c235bd06a83cdf7f40e343a30acb81
Author: dobesv <dobesv@gmail.com>
Date:   2015-11-03 18:04:30 -0800

    Add support for WWW-Authenticate header to Unauthorized
    
    In the HTTP spec, the Unauthorized response is required to provide at
    least one WWW-Authenticate challenge. This makes it easier to comply
    with that spec with Werkzeug exceptions.

Merge: 183c8556 f048c0bd

    Merge pull request #1260 from romank0/1259-closing-iterator-closes-iterable
    
    ClosingIterator closes iterable passed to it and not the iterator

commit f048c0bd1f1aa2ac111fe8f6fe05c1ec436e9739
Author: David Lord <davidism@gmail.com>
Date:   2018-05-29 16:57:01 -0700

    refactor test, add changelog

6	0	CHANGES.rst
17	30	tests/test_wsgi.py

commit 977ba0ec7de798b8abe580dd064e0a23782219ec
Author: Roman Konoval <rkonoval@gmail.com>
Date:   2018-03-02 10:43:36 +0100

    ClosingIterator closes iterable passed to it.
    
    This is a fix for https://github.com/pallets/werkzeug/issues/1259.
    
    According to [wsgi specification](https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-3333):
    
    > If the iterable returned by the application has a close() method, the
    > server or gateway must call that method upon completion of the current
    > request
    
    This commit adds test for this and fixes the issue.

48	2	tests/test_wsgi.py
5	4	werkzeug/wsgi.py

5	0	CHANGES.rst

commit 64fb22fde232bfea15aa5bc903513133a6d927bb
Author: Markus Oehme <veelai.1764@googlemail.com>
Date:   2015-04-07 11:07:56 +0200

    routing: Transparently convert a MultiDict containing parameters.
    
    This allows to pass a MultiDict and get the intuitively expected result
    (that is multiple parameters, where multiple values are present). This
    allows to recreate a URL as follows:
    
    * create a URL with multiple values for a parameter
    * use Map.match() to extract them into a MultiDict
    * recreate the URL with Map.build() handing in the MultiDict
    
    The last step would fail before this commit (in that it would reproduce only
    one of the values for each parameter). Also this avoids the collateral
    damage introduced by the last attempt at allowing MultiDicts.
    
    This zaps one of the test cases in test_basic_building to reflect the
    changed behaviour.

17	7	tests/test_routing.py
15	4	werkzeug/routing.py

commit c623b17ced4c5a19c732eedc7a4df3dbeeec902f
Merge: 2d8288b9 7a4e8b83
Author: David Lord <davidism@gmail.com>

    Merge pull request #1293 from AdamWill/subprocess-xprocess
    
    Skip tests that use 'xprocess' fixture when not installed

commit 7a4e8b834ee81aeeaa5dd0458b3986d33bb69de8
Author: Adam Williamson <awilliam@redhat.com>
Date:   2018-05-09 15:50:50 -0700

    Skip tests that use 'xprocess' fixture when not installed
    
    There's a trick in conftest.py intended to allow tests to use
    a fixture named 'subprocess', which will be the 'xprocess'
    fixture if that's available, or will cause the test to be
    skipped it it's not available. Some tests, however, just use
    the 'xprocess' fixture directly, so all those tests fail if
    it is not available.
    
    We don't really need this 'subprocess' fixture at all, it
    turns out - we can just do the same trick directly on the
    'xprocess' fixture, so all tests can use that directly (and
    also there's no confusion between this wrapper fixture and the
    commonly-used Python module called...subprocess). This
    simplifies things and makes the whole test suite run OK when
    xprocess isn't available.
    
    I noticed this when trying to run the test suite during build
    of the Fedora package - xprocess isn't packaged for Fedora yet,
    so there's no way to run the tests that use it unfortunately.
    
    Signed-off-by: Adam Williamson <awilliam@redhat.com>

4	8	tests/conftest.py
6	6	tests/contrib/cache/test_cache.py

commit 43fe889fe5a8c495c41ec28658f67c1f7b23e2cd
Author: Dan Palmer <dan@danpalmer.me>
Date:   2018-04-30 15:06:40 +0100

    Catch StopIteration as a valid case. (#1280)
    
    According to the WSGI spec[1], it is a valid case to both:
    
    a) lazily call `start_response` in request processing
    
    > this invocation may be performed by the iterables first iteration, so
    > servers must not assume that start_response() has been called before
    > they begin iterating over the iterable
    
    b) return an empty iterator (e.g. in the case of a 204 No Content)
    
    > When called by the server, the application object must return an
    > iterable yielding zero or more strings.
    
    When both of these were true, previously, Werkzeug's test client would
    propagate a `StopIteration` exception from the WSGI app's returned
    iterable. Since this is a valid case, we now catch the `StopIteration`
    exception if `start_response` has _also_ been called. If
    `start_response` has not been called we re-raise, as this is not a valid
    case under the WSGI spec, and as mentioned in the docstring of this
    function...
    
    > If passed an invalid WSGI application the behavior of this function is
    > undefined.
    
    [1]: https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0333/#specification-details
    
    Co-Authored-By: Alistair Lynn <arplynn@gmail.com>

23	0	tests/test_test.py
4	2	werkzeug/test.py

commit 72479de260d001a8b8f93ffcd582ce41edafa431
Author: Benot Allard <benoit.allard@gmx.de>
Date:   2017-12-28 22:21:11 +0100

    Allow passing a specific ipv6 address to run_simple (#1150)
    
    socket.bind() requires a fully specified address when asked to bind to a specific ipv6 address.
    With this patch, one can start a run_simple server on a specific ipv6 address.
    
    The ipv6 address has to contain the interface name (separated with a %).

commit 032c2c78b274f7cd4b204c40d46678eeea74f719
Author: Daw-Ran Liou <dawran6@gmail.com>
Date:   2017-05-25 10:36:26 -0700

    Allow chunk request
    
    Pass request.max_content_length into get_input_stream to always return a
    LimitedStream if the CONTENT_LENGTH is not set in the environ variable.
    Client is expected to set the max_content_length to the request object.
    This patch should fix issue #1094 and #1096.

commit 026bd27bd9eebed9a24f409bd491cc6a69a02b13
Author: Antonio Ossa <aaossa@uc.cl>
Date:   2017-04-15 15:21:37 -0300

    Fix bug in TyppeConversionDict (#1107)
    
    * Propagate errors during conversion
    
    During conversion, TypeConversionDict should propagate errors from the
    converter (except ValueError)
    
    Signed-off-by: Antonio Ossa <aaossa@uc.cl>
    
    * Add tests for TypeConversionDict
    
    This new test class includes three testcases: 1) Tests that the value
    conversion works, 2) tests that the default value is returned when
    conversion is not possible, and 3) tests that exceptions rased during
    conversions are propagated
    
    Signed-off-by: Antonio Ossa <aaossa@uc.cl>
    
    * Add 'bug fixed' notice to CHANGES
    
    Signed-off-by: Antonio Ossa <aaossa@uc.cl>

commit 940baabf298f8b57340651c985bb30c64c2e4ca3
Author: Nils Steinger <n-st@users.noreply.github.com>
Date:   2017-04-05 20:01:57 +0200

    Fix regression: Log client IP behind reverse proxy (#1097)
    
    As per the discussion on PR #892, this commit combines the old behaviour with
    the fallback introduced in #892:
    Use self.environ if it is available (to obtain the IP detected by `ProxyFix`,
    if any); fall back to self.client_address[0] otherwise.

commit d2b373a9ea71d4f19600d3ff388edf602f79e28b
Author: Antonio Ossa <aaossa@uc.cl>
Date:   2017-03-27 18:36:33 -0300

    Raise TypeError if port is not an integer (#1088)
    
    * Check port parameter type at run_simple
    
    Ports should be integers, so a type check is explicitly added to raise
    an exception when this is ignored. This inappropiate behaviour was
    detected when using `debug=True` in a Flask application, because a
    string is accepted and works when it should fail.
    
    Closes pallets/flask#2220
    
    Signed-off-by: Antonio Ossa <aaossa@uc.cl>
    
    * Add testcase for pallets/flask#2220
    
    This testcase tries to use a string as port parameter, which should not
    be allowed by `run_simple`. The test uses `run_simple` directly
    because the tests configuration raises the error in a different process
    without giving a chance to catch the `TypeError` exception.
    
    See pallets/flask#2220
    
    Signed-off-by: Antonio Ossa <aaossa@uc.cl>
    
    * Add PR #1088 to Changelog
    
    Signed-off-by: Antonio Ossa <aaossa@uc.cl>

2	0	CHANGES

commit 769ff09f0f345eedc2cce90717b00b5f6ed15654
Author: Dmitry Marakasov <amdmi3@amdmi3.ru>
Date:   2017-03-22 17:12:26 +0300

    Minor optimization for url_quote (#1085)
    
    * Minor optimization for url_quote
    
    Since we're working with bytes here anyway, there's no need to use
    strings and encode. This yields ~9% performance gain with python3 and
    ~23% performance gain with python2.
    
    * Further improve url_quote performance
    
    This variant fixes compatibility with python <=3.4 and yields
    additional performance improvement (total 50% with python 2, 22% with python 3)

commit f8fedab6d96665fd58ffb1682b86859b47fca64c
Merge: 1b4a6d17 09b330b5
Author: Markus Unterwaditzer <markus@unterwaditzer.net>
Date:   2017-03-12 20:39:00 +0100

    Merge branch '0.12-maintenance'

commit 09b330b5b00ef0bcc396ea42f8b894c85c003926
Author: Antonio Ossa <aaossa@uc.cl>
Date:   2017-03-12 16:38:08 -0300

    Add condition of not being under Windows to reuse file descriptor (#1081)
    
    * Add condition to reuse file descriptor
    
    Given that, under Windows, `socket.fileno`'s output "can't be used
    where a file descriptor can be used" [1], we need to add the condition
    of not being in Windows to be able to reuse the file descriptor when
    the app is reloaded
    
    Closes pallets/werkzeug#993
    Closes pallets/flask#2194
    
    [1]: https://docs.python.org/3.5/library/socket.html#socket.socket.fileno
    
    Reported-by: @BennyAlex, @JLinthorst and @aaossa
    Signed-off-by: Antonio Ossa <aaossa@uc.cl>
    
    * Add PR #1081 to changelog
    
    Signed-off-by: Antonio Ossa <aaossa@uc.cl>

3	0	CHANGES
2	2	werkzeug/serving.py

Author: Wang Dpng <wonderfuly@gmail.com>

commit 3d37d17dadb918d2e0308930894a012d93260d72
Author: Philippe Ombredanne <pombredanne@gmail.com>
Date:   2016-11-01 13:11:19 -0700

    Add license_file to setup.cfg metadata (#1006)
    
    Without this, the LICENSE file is never included in the built wheels: this makes it harder for users to comply with the license.
    With this addition a file LICENSE.txt will be created in the `xxx.dist-info` directory with the content of the `license_file` file, e.g. the top level LICENSE.

commit 02f5784afce7779450f8f6be7c083dab5670ca68
Author: Roy Williams <roy.williams.iii@gmail.com>
Date:   2016-10-19 11:59:13 -0700

    Fix some Python 3 issues flagged by the -3 flag and Pylint (#1017)
    
    * Fix some Python 3 issues flagged by the -3 flag and Pylint
    
    I've been working through looking at adopting Python 3, and I've been utilizing the `-3` flag to help idenitfy issues with Python 3.
    
    Here's a quick write up I did last week:
    
    https://gist.github.com/rowillia/c0feed97c1863b2d8e5a3ed73712df65
    
    The `-3` flagged a few issues in `werkzeug` worth fixing, namely around `__eq__` shadowing `__hash__` in PY3.
    
    Fixing these issues will help make the `-3` flag less noisey for folks running Werkzeug in production.
    
    * Added tests, removed unneeded bool cast
    
    * Fix tests, fix lint

Author: Gonri Le Bouder <goneri@lebouder.net>
Date:   2016-10-01 10:26:01 -0400

    test: accept fd for post() data parameter (#1011)
    
    It's possible to pass an open file descriptor to the post() method
    of requests. This patch ensures the test client also accepts the
    parameter instead of this error message:
    
        E   AttributeError: 'file' object has no attribute 'iteritems'
    
    See: http://docs.python-requests.org/en/master/api/#requests.post

commit ebf00f9d76ca2017b069e16c014216abfd2fa745
Author: Marcelo Duarte <marcelotduarte@users.noreply.github.com>
Date:   2016-08-29 13:10:27 -0300

    check file size (#959)
    
    * check file size
    
    In a frozen app, using 'pkg_resources' the file size returned is zero, and with development server the files/images are not shown. With cherrypy wsigserver, throw a exception with ValueError about content-length. With this patch, all is fine.
    With this patch, exclusively when content-length is zero, this information isn't passed and firefox and chrome accept the image/scripts/etc and show all.

commit 7c07654250461b0f753efd6dc3976df44d3b94f8
Author: Lars Holm Nielsen <lars.holm.nielsen@cern.ch>
Date:   2016-08-25 11:28:59 +0200

    Fix parse_options_header for invalid content types (#995)
    
    Invalid content types starting with comma or semi-colon would result in
    and empty tuple being returned by parse_options_header, however all uses
    of parse_options_header always expected a two-tuple to be returned.
    
    (Closes #995)

commit e50ad44745f891686fc77d9b6ccf03e3db27f8f4
Author: Ed Morley <edmorley@users.noreply.github.com>
Date:   2016-05-09 22:02:09 +0200

    Add an extras_require entry for the optional watchdog dependency (#930)
    
    The reloader feature has an optional dependency on watchdog:
    http://werkzeug.pocoo.org/docs/0.11/serving/#reloader
    
    This change allows the use of `Werkzeug[watchdog]` in requirements
    files, which makes the reason behind the dependency clearer, and also
    allows for version specifiers to be more easily introduced in the future,
    should there be incompatibilities with certain versions of watchdog.
    
    Fixes #929.

2	1	docs/serving.rst
3	0	setup.py

    * Recognize Baiduspider useragent
    
    * Upadte CHANGES
    
    * Recognize sunos platform.
    
    * Didn't realize sunos was already there in the platforms list.
    
    Move sunos before linux in the platforms list so that it gets matched in
    the UA string.
    
    * Add test case for iceweasel useragent
    
    * Few more user agent parsing related changes:
    
    Add mozilla at the end of the browsers list, so that if none of the
    other browsers are matched, we fallback to mozilla (most of the
            useragents have Mozilla/5.0 present)
    Recognize bing bot as well.
    Also, add a test string for chrome on windows
    
    * Update CHANGES
    
    * Fix indentation
    
    * Add support for recognizing DragonFlyBSD too.

    version being recognized as the seamonkey version.

4	0	werkzeug/wrappers.py

commit 22b6415600e962951745eb03841f8ace514db980
Author: Lars Butler <Lars.Butler@gmail.com>
Date:   2016-04-10 06:55:45 +0200

    Make set_cookie() secure `param` a bool by default
    
    This is basically just a change for the sake of consistency. The
    `httponly` param has a default value of `False`. Technically `None` has
    a truth value of `False`, but this could lead to confusion.

1	1	werkzeug/wrappers.py

commit 2185b8920499b37b2205a076e5a827fc9e037625
Author: Lars Butler <Lars.Butler@gmail.com>
Date:   2016-04-10 06:51:40 +0200

    Fix cookie keyword arguments
    
    `werkzeug.wrappers.BaseResponse.set_cookie` and
    `werkzeug.http.dump_cookie` both accept a ton of keyword
    arguments. Both in tests and in the `wrappers` code, arguments were
    being passed instead as positional arguments. While this is
    syntactically okay, it is better style to specify arguments with the
    explicit keyword prefix. This also helps prevent future bugs related to
    the insertion or deletion of more keyword arguments in these functions.

2	1	tests/test_wrappers.py
9	3	werkzeug/wrappers.py

commit 831318ecd2c67b93e3bb8b97c3ccb4aa4826df2a
Author: Markus Unterwaditzer <markus@unterwaditzer.net>
Date:   2016-03-30 22:19:12 +0200

    Changelog for #874

2	0	CHANGES

commit 8410f194e5a4e207d6d9562736c215b8ca13750d
Merge: bd016822 767485df
Author: Homu <homu@barosl.com>
Date:   2016-03-31 05:17:54 +0900

    Auto merge of #874 - Neurostack:master, r=untitaker
    
    Fixed infinite loop FileStorage iter in python 3
    
    In python 3 if you would iterate over FileStorage and the underlying stream returned bytes arrays the existing sentinel, being the empty string, would never equate to an empty bytes array and an infinite loop would occur. To fix this, I query if the underlying stream inherits from TextIOBase and set the sentinel to an empty string otherwise I set it to an empty bytes array so StopIteration will be called at the end of the file correctly. This is backwards compatible with python 2 as '' == b'' and it does not matter which of these the sentinel is set to.

commit 767485dfbcf93c069225e842ace382f314e64c9b
Author: Neurostack <nedrud@email.arizona.edu>
Date:   2016-03-02 12:55:49 -0700

    Fixed infinite loop FileStorage iter in python 3
    
    In python 3 if you would iterate over FileStorage and the underlying stream returned bytes arrays the existing sentinel, being the empty string, would never equate to an empty bytes array and an infinite loop would occur. To fix this, I query if the underlying stream inherits from TextIOBase and set the sentinel to an empty string otherwise I set it to an empty bytes array so StopIteration will be called at the end of the file correctly. This is backwards compatible with python 2 as '' == b'' and it does not matter which of these the sentinel is set to.
    
    Added test for 26dea8fa977adaf6f311184f12eab3c891853d27
    
    added io import to test case
    
    updated FileStorage with more elegant fix
    
    Added unicode specifier for StringIO in py2

12	0	tests/test_datastructures.py
1	1	werkzeug/datastructures.py

Merge: 8608a9f5 e48c7617
Author: Homu <homu@barosl.com>
Date:   2016-03-30 02:09:39 +0900

    Auto merge of #789 - jfinkels:simplify-accept, r=untitaker
    
    Simplifies Accept header constructor.
    
    This commit removes the function calls and in-place sorting in favor of
    using the built-in `sorted` method with the appropriate `key` and
    `reverse` keyword arguments.
    
    As justification,
    - this reduces the number of lists in memory by one,
    - this uses the `reverse` keyword argument to the built-in `sorted` function instead of manually calling `sort()` and `reverse()`,
    - the number of function calls is reduced (though some of the work is offloaded to the `sorted()` function):
    
       ```python
    >>> from dis import dis
    >>> def f(values):
    ...     return sorted(values, key=lambda x: (x[1], x[0]), reverse=True)
    ...
    >>> dis(f)
      2           0 LOAD_GLOBAL              0 (sorted)
                  3 LOAD_FAST                0 (values)
                  6 LOAD_CONST               1 ('key')
                  9 LOAD_CONST               2 (<code object <lambda> at 0x7fb389fa4c90, file "<stdin>", line 2>)
                 12 LOAD_CONST               3 ('f.<locals>.<lambda>')
                 15 MAKE_FUNCTION            0
                 18 LOAD_CONST               4 ('reverse')
                 21 LOAD_CONST               5 (True)
                 24 CALL_FUNCTION          513 (1 positional, 2 keyword pair)
                 27 RETURN_VALUE
    
    >>> def g(values):
    ...             values = [(a, b) for b, a in values]
    ...             values.sort()
    ...             values.reverse()
    ...             return values
    ...
    >>> dis(g)
      2           0 LOAD_CONST               1 (<code object <listcomp> at 0x7fb38a0580c0, file "<stdin>", line 2>)
                  3 LOAD_CONST               2 ('g.<locals>.<listcomp>')
                  6 MAKE_FUNCTION            0
                  9 LOAD_FAST                0 (values)
                 12 GET_ITER
                 13 CALL_FUNCTION            1 (1 positional, 0 keyword pair)
                 16 STORE_FAST               0 (values)
    
      3          19 LOAD_FAST                0 (values)
                 22 LOAD_ATTR                0 (sort)
                 25 CALL_FUNCTION            0 (0 positional, 0 keyword pair)
                 28 POP_TOP
    
      4          29 LOAD_FAST                0 (values)
                 32 LOAD_ATTR                1 (reverse)
                 35 CALL_FUNCTION            0 (0 positional, 0 keyword pair)
                 38 POP_TOP
    
      5          39 LOAD_FAST                0 (values)
                 42 RETURN_VALUE
       ```

commit 8608a9f5295dfc1923a22e0b540b5d5941a17230
Merge: 53afb2fc 4afd1413
Author: Homu <homu@barosl.com>
Date:   2016-03-30 01:21:21 +0900

    Auto merge of #770 - snoack:threading, r=untitaker
    
    Use daemon threads for threaded test server
    
    When using `werkzeug.serving.run_simle(..., threaded=True)` the worker threads still keep running after the main thread is terminated either by pressing `Ctrl-C` or when using the reloader. This can easily be reproduced with `ab -n 1000 -c 10 http://120.0.0.1:5000`.
    
    That is because `ThreadingMixIn.daemon_threads`, in the [socketserver](https://docs.python.org/3/library/socketserver.html) module, defaults to `False`. When overriding this attribute with the value `True` in the `ThreadedWSGIServer` class, the program will terminate as soon as the main thread exits, which is the expected behavior for a test server.

5	5	README.rst

commit 53afb2fc345100ca657f256f43f5cc157d32b0c4
Merge: 8d7bf84d 1fc28cbb
Author: Homu <homu@barosl.com>
Date:   2016-03-30 01:08:48 +0900

    Auto merge of #762 - snordhausen:master, r=untitaker
    
    Log the actual listen port, not the configured one
    
    When the listen port is configured to "0", the kernel randomly assigns a free TCP port to the server. This is the port we should log, because the server is only reachable there, not on port 0.
    
    Setting the port to 0 is useful when you start a web server to run integration tests with/against it, e.g. on a developers desktop or on a build server. You don't want to rely on any specific port being available for that server. Instead you start the server on some port that is available, read the logs to figure out which port was assigned to it, then run the tests with that server.

    caching backend. Note that this caching method will not work when run in pypy,
    as uWSGI's pypy bindings does not contain the necessary functionality.

Author: jab <jab@users.noreply.github.com>

5	1	werkzeug/http.py

commit b1f1be90abe7f1ebad7cf1cf9f0e48f316fa10b9
Author: jab <jab@users.noreply.github.com>
Date:   2016-02-02 21:00:37 -0500

    Fix incorrect case of weak etag indicator
    
    According to http://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc7232#section-2.3
    weakness must be specified via `W/` (note "case-sensitive").
    Werkzeug's use of `w/` causes strict reverse proxies such as
    CloudFlare to drop the ETag header entirely.

commit 1144ee92113497e1880213c6c98b4981c9d71330

commit acadf7ed3059db1decedbd7b7e4d17e33d7274c2
Author: Stefan Nordhausen <stefan.nordhausen@immobilienscout24.de>
Date:   2015-08-18 12:53:58 +0200

    Log the actual listen port, not the configured one
    
    When the listen port is configured to "0", the kernel randomly
    assigns a free TCP port to the server. This is the port we should
    log, because the server is only reachable there, not on port 0.

commit 80ff4b3fc4af27c0ac7b3216e15fd7a3fd67f4b9
Author: KR <kr@uber.com>
Date:   2015-03-02 21:33:33 -0800

    Make RedisCache work with clients that don't support MULTI
    
    RedisCache:set_many uses pipleline, which in turn uses MULTI redis
    command which is not supported by twemproxy. The default transaction
    isnt required, as the pipeline is being used to batch commands and
    isnt relying on transactional semantics.
    
    Fixes https://github.com/mitsuhiko/werkzeug/issues/612

2	0	CHANGES
4	1	werkzeug/contrib/cache.py

commit 6ea4180261b01a3f048a6d60d3f0f7cc29447f45

Date:   2015-03-20 20:36:07 +0100

    Only wrap in ClosingIterator if necessary
    
    In situations where
    
    * app_iter is app_rv (the app already returned an iterator)
    * the app's rv has a close method
    
    it happened that Werkzeug's closing iterator would register two
    callbacks -- once directly picked from the app_iter, once explicitly
    passed.

5	5	werkzeug/test.py

commit 0647b54045634aaace5228a429a147f4399efe25
Author: Markus Unterwaditzer <markus@unterwaditzer.net>
Date:   2015-03-19 17:25:30 +0100

    Fix a bug in Werkzeug regarding closing iterators

28	1	tests/test_test.py
2	2	werkzeug/test.py

commit fb9e7c3eeccfdf39670518439dfae154c717ef18
Author: Markus Unterwaditzer <markus@unterwaditzer.net>
Date:   2015-03-19 17:16:30 +0100

    Fix #712
    
    When an application both
    
    * returns an iterable
    * calls start_response *after* a part of the response has
      been consumed
    
    run_wsgi_app breaks in unbuffered mode:
    
          File "/Users/kakashi/Programs/project/.env/lib/python2.7/site-packages/werkzeug/test.py", line 873, in run_wsgi_app
            buffer.append(next(app_iter))
        TypeError: _WSGIApplicationIterable object is not an iterator
    
    See https://discuss.newrelic.com/t/werkzeug-cant-work-properly-when-using-agent-2-40-0-34/13318/4
    and https://github.com/mitsuhiko/werkzeug/issues/712

commit 13192fb7a9b0c2f8c33704449726f61ec518edf2
Author: Thomas Meson <zllak@hycik.org>
Date:   2015-03-12 16:17:10 +0100

    Get the real safari version in useragents
    
    User agents for Safari are a bit different from other UA.
    The version is not found in the form <browser>/<version> but in the form
    Version/<version> Safari/<build number>.
    To correctly get the Safari version, we have to apply this small fix,
    otherwise, we get the build number.

1	1	werkzeug/useragents.py

commit 919e6515b45c3f19cebdc4681f2055a19ca5ea4e
Author: Moritz Emanuel Beber <beber@molgen.mpg.de>
Date:   2015-02-12 11:25:58 +0100

    relax strict test for bytes type
    
    The formerly strict test `type(data) is bytes` is changed to an `isinstance`
    check that allows subclasses to work. This allows, for example, the `bytes`
    backport to Python 2 from the `future` package to work.

11	0	CHANGES

commit 93c09610e3a7e5740cfbdfd6c277c8fddcc2d47e
Author: Travis Swicegood <development@domain51.com>
Date:   2015-02-07 11:22:14 -0800

    Refactor to allow providing custom kwargs
    
    As noted in the previous commit, subclasses may need to provide their
    own kwargs to interact with their custom functionality.  Currently, you
    have to overwrite empty() and then add your custom behavior on top of
    the default return.  This refactoring allows you to provide your own
    custom kwargs by overriding get_empty_kwargs() and modifing the
    dictionary of values it returns.

9	6	werkzeug/routing.py

commit 1b0fb7500bc14c5c83b92b19e81c30c186d202c7
Author: Travis Swicegood <development@domain51.com>
Date:   2015-02-07 11:15:41 -0800

    Fix issue where subclasses provide custom kwargs
    
    This makes the previous test pass and makes it unnecessary to do
    `kwarg.pop()` work arounds like the one in [this commit][1].
    
    [1]: https://github.com/tswicegood/steinie/commit/2b5c01cf37de6439e62d29a08ce92f3aec5de0cf

6	3	werkzeug/routing.py

commit 0bdb413d84a464987bd1347b074c1eb5b2b85ff2
Author: Travis Swicegood <development@domain51.com>
Date:   2015-02-07 11:12:38 -0800

    Add failing test case to show broken Rule issue in 0.10
    
    This was introduced in 426b98534fa623294100c4b14fe0d8fd7fa66e58 which
    properly instantiates the subclass of a Rule instead of returning a Rule
    object.  The issue is that empty() uses args instead of kwargs, so
    anyone relying on kwargs to inject a new value will have bugs
    introduced.

Author: David Szotten <davidszotten@gmail.com>
Date:   2015-01-30 14:53:30 +0000

    keep an eventlet-friendly reference to time.sleep
    
    otherwise, when eventlet.monkey_patch replaces time.sleep,
    this raises a TypeError when called, since while adding the builtin
    sleep to the ReloaderLoop we stil end up with a function, but when
    replaced, we end up with a method, which now expects a self argument.

commit b025006f598f0f480eb1ac8a339b79e55153e3b4
Author: veelai <oehme.markus@gmx.de>
Date:   2015-01-29 14:41:52 +0100

    routing.build: Allow multiple values for the same field
    
    This allows to construct urls like
    'http://example.com/?multi=1&multi=2&multi=3' which have multiple
    values for the same field. This is common practice for most web
    frameworks. The reverse operation is allready supported, i.e. multiple
    values get aggregated into a MultiDict.

1	0	CHANGES
10	0	tests/test_routing.py
1	1	werkzeug/routing.py

commit 426b98534fa623294100c4b14fe0d8fd7fa66e58
Author: Sharoon Thomas <sharoon.thomas@openlabs.co.in>
Date:   2014-12-23 17:16:41 +0530

    Fix inheritance with Rule.empty
    
    Rule.empty() always returned an instance of werkzeug.routing.Rule
    even when a Rule subclass existed. This patch ensures that the
    new instance of the rule returned by empty() is always an instance
    of the class the rule is an instance of.

Author: masklinn <github.com@masklinn.net>
Date:   2014-12-17 15:10:27 +0100

    Invalidate Content-Length after writing to ResponseStreamMixin.stream
    
    Otherwise a Content-Length set previously (via set_data or make_conditional)
    will lead to clients using the existing Content-Length and discarding all the
    data written via the stream interface fixes #451

    `_get_content_type` behavior to depend on the presence of content rather
    than the HTTP method used, which addresses the initial goal of allowing
    DELETE requests to properly send content without explicitly specifying
    the content type.

5	1	werkzeug/contrib/fixers.py

commit 8c26eafd3edcfa5974f5872f43e1fedcd3950946
Author: Markus Unterwaditzer <markus@unterwaditzer.net>
Date:   2014-10-12 22:13:41 +0200

    Decode traceback filenames with correct encoding
    
    @mitsuhiko 's python-unio library actually assumes utf-8 on
    Linux and BSD. I decided to commit this simple change instead because
    the worst things that could happen would be:
    
    1. Werkzeug's debugger crashes again on decoding, like it did before
    2. The filenames are garbled and we end up with empty code blocks for
       some frames in the in-browser traceback.
    
    None of these cases seems to be critical enough to justify the inclusion
    of a complex stdlib wrapper like it's done in python-unio.
    
    Fix #469

2	0	CHANGES
14	0	tests/test_debug.py
2	2	werkzeug/debug/tbtools.py

commit 56f15bdf4f4b182c580c90ecadc02a671653fb78
Merge: 44ac72bc ac151cb1
Author: Markus Unterwaditzer <markus@unterwaditzer.net>
Date:   2014-09-04 17:58:29 +0200

    Merge branch 'fix/accept-best-matches-quality-zero'
    
    Fix #536

commit ac151cb1d91b60cf025295a53d03a7c3e72855ff
Author: Joshua C. Randall <jcrandall@alum.mit.edu>
Date:   2014-06-04 23:44:48 +0100

    Adds test cases for Accept, including best_match
    
    One test is an expected failure. This is because the
    current implementation does not correctly implement
    specificity. I tried decorating this with
    @unittest.expectedFailure, but that didn't work for
    python 2.6 so I've now commented out that test instead.
    
    The problem is if the accept header on the request is:
    `Accept: x;q=0,y;q=0.5,*;q=1`
    Then `x` should never be the best match because it has
    been specifically declared as q=0. However, in the current
    implementation, werkzeug will see *;q=1 first and decide
    that everything matches the wildcard. This is not correct
    behaviour according to RFC2616, as an `x` should match the
    specific entry for `x` rather than the wildcard entry `*`,
    but more substantial changes would be needed to fix this.

70	1	tests/test_datastructures.py

commit c9bb97ca8a73f0df8a25e1fd36e502f358be440d
Author: Joshua C. Randall <jcrandall@alum.mit.edu>
Date:   2014-05-31 19:59:13 +0100

    Fixes Accept.best_matches
    
    Only includes Accept items in consideration for best_matches if they have q>0, as a quality of 0 should be equivalent to not being included in the list at all.
    
    This agrees with RFC2616 (http://www.w3.org/Protocols/rfc2616/rfc2616-sec3.html#sec3.9):
    ```
    If a parameter has a quality value of 0, then content with this parameter is `not acceptable' for the client.
    ```

2	1	werkzeug/datastructures.py

Merge: 5bf12fa6 d7218a3e

commit d7218a3ebac7c013dc5d2d6ece5a5a84b68d9e16
Author: Markus Unterwaditzer <markus@unterwaditzer.net>
Date:   2014-09-02 15:24:04 +0200

    Use old instead of new-style string formatting
    
    >#pocoo on freenode
    >
    >[15:12:50] <mitsuhiko> % formatting does python 2 style string coercion on python 2 and what python 3 does on python 3
    >[15:13:01] <mitsuhiko> .format has python 3 semantics on all pythons
    >[15:13:17] <mitsuhiko> which means that '{}={}'.format(u'\N{SNOWMAN}', 'x') as a unicode error
    >[15:13:19] <untitaker> ah i see bytes % unicode == unicode
    >[15:13:27] <mitsuhiko> and bytes.format(unicode) == bytes
    >[15:13:45] <mitsuhiko> so you can accidentally degrade apis on python 2
    >[15:15:16] <mitsuhiko> so in this particular case it's not changing anything
    >[15:15:30] <mitsuhiko> just in general i know that people are unaware of this distinction and it can cause subtle bugs
    >[15:15:36] <mitsuhiko> so i general try to not use format() on python 2 code if possible

1	1	werkzeug/datastructures.py

commit bc971237c84124775f6ba8cbd96b6fb60df53fa2
Author: Joe Esposito <joe@joeyespo.com>
Date:   2014-08-26 22:00:24 -0400

    Allow protocol-relative URLs.
    
    This helps you handle mixed-content errors when building URLs for external
    sites. This should only be used when your site handles both http and https.
    
    When the scheme is omitted, 'http' will continue to be the default when
    building redirect URLs, since they're required to be fully qualified.

7	5	werkzeug/routing.py

Merge: b4d524bc e572f25f
Author: Markus Unterwaditzer <markus@unterwaditzer.net>
Date:   2014-08-26 00:23:28 +0200

    Merge pull request #574 from mitsuhiko/memcached_timeouts
    
    MemcachedCache timeouts are now standardized

commit e572f25fa72b60929ef85f0079d160c9eed4a98e
Author: Markus Unterwaditzer <markus@unterwaditzer.net>
Date:   2014-08-26 00:12:46 +0200

    MemcachedCache timeouts are now standardized
    
    Fix issue #533
    
    From original commit by @dasmith91:
    
    >MemcachedCache forwards its timeout parameter to the native Memcache
    >client. This has an unexpected behaviour of timeouts greater than
    >2592000 seconds (30 days) are treated as unix timestamps. By appending
    >the current unix time to all timestamps, MemcachedCache's behaviour
    >matches that of the other Caches provided in cache.py.

2	0	CHANGES

commit d734e2a77b1368a7ea01ef6fbe410362bca6ba6b
Author: Markus Unterwaditzer <markus@unterwaditzer.net>
Date:   2014-08-19 23:31:59 +0200

    Fix wrong testcase
    
    Quoted from the dump_cookie docs:
    
    >On Python 3 the return value of this function will be a unicode
    >string, on Python 2 it will be a native string.
    
    So in both cases it's a native string.
    
    Also related: https://bitbucket.org/pypy/pypy/issue/1849/py2-a-b-csplit-u-returns-wrong-different
    
    Backport from f2b98e127d3edd6e57b43fc901c6628ea6fca8b7
    
    Conflicts:
            werkzeug/testsuite/http.py

Date:   2014-05-31 12:41:39 +0200

    Fix bug in try_coerce_native
    
    In Python 3:
    
        str(b'foo')
    
    will return the repr instead of a decoded string.

Merge: 9b9078f9 b2f7480a
Author: Jess Austin <jess.austin@gmail.com>

            werkzeug/http.py

commit 9b9078f93701254f161851506896dc8b30a7cb90
Author: Jess Austin <jess.austin@gmail.com>
Date:   2012-07-23 12:09:01 -0500

    Handle media types with parameters
    
    Some media types included in the "Accept" header include parameters. These
    media type parameters are distinct from "q" and any other "accept-param", and
    are listed before "q". With this patch these parameters don't cause errors.
    (See sections 3.7 and 14.1 of RFC2616 for more information.)

2	2	werkzeug/http.py
2	0	werkzeug/testsuite/http.py

    Fix #502
    
    The code so far made far too many assumptions about the format used by
    pickle, the changes introduced by PEP 3154 finally caused this to become
    a real issue. This changes the code to make no assumptions about the
    representation whatsoever, making it work with protocol 4, all future
    protocols.

14	4	werkzeug/testsuite/datastructures.py

commit f6cd240459febc07ae000f399f471803d10550e4
Author: Daniel Neuhauser <dasdasich@gmail.com>

    Add quit message change to changelog

1	0	CHANGES

commit b426fe7ed1ae571bcd3682545b0b6f0ae8b14f46
Author: Kevin Burke <kevin@twilio.com>
Date:   2013-11-05 08:35:27 -0800

    Explain how to quit the debug server
    
    Many new users start the server in debug mode locally, then don't know how to
    kill it or "get their terminal back" after the Werkzeug server starts. This
    adds a short message explaining how to quit the server and "get your terminal
    back". CTRL+C works on Mac and Linux and according to the IRC channel, Windows
    as well, otherwise we'd probably want to customize the message depending on the
    host OS.
    
    This message is similar to Python's "Use quit() or Ctrl-D (i.e. EOF) to exit"
    when you type "quit" in the REPL.

3	2	werkzeug/serving.py

commit dd8cbd8ad9079ea01610ed420b64fb59539fd901
Author: Armin Ronacher <armin.ronacher@active-4.com>
Date:   2013-07-25 11:37:35 +0200

    Changed .data and .get_data() again
    
    This restores the old pre 0.9 behavior for the data attribute
    on request objects and it gives the .get_data() method a
    parameter to have that same behavior.  In addition to that a
    new method was added that creates a stream for parsing that
    honors previously cached data.  This is now also being used
    by the form data parser.

commit 6bcab711ca34a6009161d8a3bb87a43a0dd4b8f8
Author: Armin Ronacher <armin.ronacher@active-4.com>
Date:   2013-06-13 14:02:41 +0100

    Fixed issues with url quoting and integers.
    
    - url_quote now no longer casts an integer to a bytearray but
      instead takes any non string looking value through text_type().
    - the routing system no longer attempts to convert values to
      bytes before passing it to bytes solving type errors on non
      string url generations.

3	0	CHANGES
1	1	werkzeug/routing.py
7	0	werkzeug/testsuite/routing.py
1	0	werkzeug/testsuite/urls.py
2	0	werkzeug/urls.py

Author: Armin Ronacher <armin.ronacher@active-4.com>
Date:   2013-06-03 00:18:55 +0100

    Fixed missing usages of the WSGI encoding dance.
    
    Added new functions to deal with the WSGI environment on
    Python 2 and Python 3 in the same way:
    
    - get_script_name
    - get_query_string
    - get_path_info
    
    Also made the peeking and poking of path infos in the
    environment dictionary return properly decoded unicode
    to avoid exposing the encoding dance to users.

commit d25db7a696ace8e9296cee0dc412f0fd40fe5d67
Author: Daniel Neuhauser <dasdasich@gmail.com>
Date:   2013-05-20 14:01:42 +0200

    Introduce separator encoding magic in make_chunk_iter
    
    Unfortunately not every caller of make_chunk_iter knows with what kind
    of stream it is calling make_chunk_iter, consequently it cannot
    determine whether to use a unicode or bytes separator. Therefore we
    assume the separator is ascii encoded and handle both cases in
    make_chunk_iter.

7	1	werkzeug/wsgi.py

commit 138cc4c1452ed1155ce819dc2da2125716bb90ac
Author: Nathan Hoad <nathan@getoffmalawn.com>
Date:   2013-04-13 04:49:50 +1000

    Allow alternative dict-like objects to be used in parse_dict_header.
    
    RFC 3507 (ICAP) Section 4.4.1 states that the Encapsulated header values
    must be ordered monotonically; something the current implementation
    doesn't guarantee.
    
    This patch allows the use of an OrderedDict to provide that functionality.

4	3	werkzeug/http.py

commit add5c65fa8c88c765f2003b2ed1bfe893cdefcd6

commit 0fe8e91984f24aa25d511c398c63897023615621
Author: Markus Unterwaditzer <markus@unterwaditzer.net>
Date:   2013-03-04 17:32:32 +0100

    Fix relying on order of unordered types
    
    Modified version of #234
    
    All changed tests have in common that they assert a specific ordering of
    an unordered data structure (dict or set). The assertions have been made
    more liberal with respect to the order of entries.
    
    Command used for finding failures of this kind:
    for i in `seq 100`; do echo PYTHONHASHSEED=$i;
    PYTHONHASHSEED=$i $PYTHON run-tests.py || break; done

commit eb8aef765162a1633c7e4ed81744c51018ad0dc7
Author: Timothee Boucher <timothee@gmail.com>
Date:   2013-01-10 20:25:47 -0800

    Fix error when creating a Response with e.g. "404"
    
    If you call Response() with a status of "404" as a string
    (`Response('foo', status="404")`) without the reason as part of the
    string, the setting of the message `msg` will fail because
    `status.split(None, 1)` will have only one value and can't be unpacked
    to code and msg.
    
    In wrappers.py, the status can be parsed to an int (line 753),
    so status is set to (string) "404" and status_code is set to (int) 404.
    
    RFC 2616 allows for an empty reason message to be sent. Without this fix,
    you can't actually sent an empty message and you'll get an error if
    you're trying to build a Response object based on the response from
    a third-party server that could send an empty reason message.
    (though probably rare, it happened to me, which is how I came across the
    problem)
    
    Signed-off-by: Timothee Boucher <timothee@gmail.com>

4	1	werkzeug/serving.py

commit fabd3df1bf8ba60e8851057b0c29dd98235ba246
Author: Timothee Boucher <timothee@gmail.com>
Date:   2013-01-10 08:36:03 -0800

    Fix error when creating a Response with status "foo bar"
    
    Say your app does `return Response("baz", status="foo bar").
    
    In wrappers.py, when the status property is set, if it can't be parsed
    to an int (line 753), the status code is set to 0. However, in
    serving.py lines 115, 116, we try to parse it again to an int which
    fails. (again)
    
    This fixes it by changing the status code to 0 as before and then the
    status to "0 %s" % status. (-> "0 foo bar")
    This can then be parsed properly in serving.py. (though admittedly, the
    question is open to know if it should continue at all if Response() is
    called with such a status in the first place...)
    
    Signed-off-by: Timothee Boucher <timothee@gmail.com>

1	0	werkzeug/testsuite/wrappers.py
1	0	werkzeug/wrappers.py

commit b2f7480a34bfb688517d992e8696d0a73e3f0c78
Author: Jess Austin <jess.austin@gmail.com>
Date:   2012-07-23 12:09:01 -0500

    Handle media types with parameters
    
    Some media types included in the "Accept" header include parameters. These
    media type parameters are distinct from "q" and any other "accept-param", and
    are listed before "q". With this patch these parameters don't cause errors.
    (See sections 3.7 and 14.1 of RFC2616 for more information.)

commit 0a3b95f665c11ea380dff7cade86564b260d1375
Author: Conor Hennessy <chennessy@demonware.net>
Date:   2012-07-03 05:13:25 -0700

    Fix the 'processes' comment which is a bit misleading.
    
    It says "number of processes to spawn", but what it does is enable
    the SocketServer.ForkingMixIn which 'handles each request in a new process'.
    
    Its value is not the number of processes but the maximum number of processes
    that the ForkinMixIn will allow at the same time.

commit cfd22fcb82eed96e1964f675752d19bd081fa734
Author: Marien Zwart <marien.zwart@gmail.com>
Date:   2012-06-03 15:55:27 +0200

    Stop relying on the message text of ZeroDivisionError in tests.
    
    The test for broken_repr relied on the message text of
    ZeroDivisionError, which is different on pypy (just "integer
    division", not "integer division or modulo"). This causes a test
    failure. Fix this by explicitly raising an exception with a message we
    provide.

    Add convenience method to access the full path.
    
    The "full path" is terminology for the request's path plus the query
    string.
    
    The term is borrowed from Django, which implements the get_full_path()
    method on requests.

commit b05387384a4d25ef2d51187fef36e4dd4c6db916
Author: Ned Jackson Lovely <njl@njl.us>
Date:   2012-03-13 18:02:57 -0400

    Fix #120, disable redis tests if no connection
    
    If the redis library is installed, an attempt is made to automatically
    run redis unit tests. This might not work if redis is not running,
    not local, etc, etc, etc. This patch will attempt to connect to redis
    after the redis import, and will set redis = None if an attempted
    connection fails, skipping the unit tests for redis as a result.
    
    Signed-off-by: Armin Ronacher <armin.ronacher@active-4.com>

5	0	werkzeug/testsuite/contrib/cache.py

commit 2cf68972552abec75b3d96f8e3af3d759ef06987
Author: Gavin Wahl <gwahl@fusionbox.com>
Date:   2012-02-17 10:45:34 -0700

    Disable Chrome reflected XSS protection on debug page
    
    Chrome was falsely detecting a potential XSS attack on the debug
    console. This patch disables it on the debug page only with
    `X-XSS-Protection: 0`
    
    Signed-off-by: Armin Ronacher <armin.ronacher@active-4.com>

commit cbd8ec9b20405b406a8a701b34087a349b656d5d
Author: Andrey Popp <8mayday@gmail.com>
Date:   2012-03-03 18:49:21 +0400

    werkzeug.local: fix Proxy.{__enter__,__exit__,__coerce__}
    
    werkzeug.local.Proxy.{__enter__,__exit__,__coerce__} were not implemented
    correctly thus triggering "RuntimeError: maximum recursion depth exceeded"

commit 8b8a41ba28dbf832bc699dd23ae7e4f72c2c080a
Author: vickenty <vickenty@yandex-team.ru>
Date:   2011-12-28 19:46:28 +0400

    Do not quote percent sign when converting IRI to URI.
    
    According to RFC3987, percent-encoded parts are valid in IRIs as well as in URIs and do not need to be additionaly encoded.

commit 96fdb17b46ff14a2bbc9617e54ebc13eddbebbf4
Author: posativ <info@posativ.org>
Date:   2011-09-01 17:36:06 +0200

    make nc and cnonce optional
    
    nc and cnonce are only required, when qop is specified. Currently, werkzeug
    can not handle the original HTTP Digest Authentication specified in RFC 2069.
    
    This "feature" blocks the a popular ruby HTTP library `httparty` (I've
    created a feature request, though).
    
    (I don't think, werkzeug needs the whole serverside implementation of HTTP Digest as
    pull requested in https://github.com/mitsuhiko/werkzeug/pull/69, this can
    be included in Frameworks like Flask)
    
    [1]: https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc2069

4	2	werkzeug/http.py

commit 1deb54dbe112323bb7e8f69507aeb79cc82f728e
Author: Armin Ronacher <armin.ronacher@active-4.com>
Date:   2011-08-29 11:29:10 +0200

    Since locals are usually per-thread we can remove a few locks.
    
    If someone really uses locals in a non-per thread environment they
    would have deadlocked the code most likely anyways so it's safer
    we move the burden of locking to the caller's side.

commit 57a361c6ee8570c6062b34907275ff7f432a84d4
Author: Ian Lewis <IanMLewis@gmail.com>
Date:   2010-11-07 11:46:18 +0900

    Changed naked except statements to catch only subclasses of Exception.
    
    Naked except statements catch subclasses of BaseException which
    can occur anywhere (i.e. KeyboardInterrupt).
    
    Unexpected issues can occur when the exception happens during the
    loading of a module. The python interpreter doesn't know about a
    module's failed load and does not remove it from sys.modules. This
    is particularly a problem on AppEngine where DeadlineExceededErrors
    can occur anywhere and modules that catch the error cause python to
    think the module is loaded but in fact the module load has failed.
    
    See: http://code.google.com/p/googleappengine/issues/detail?id=1409
    Signed-off-by: Armin Ronacher <armin.ronacher@active-4.com>

1	1	tests/test_wrappers.py
1	1	werkzeug/__init__.py
1	1	werkzeug/_internal.py
3	3	werkzeug/contrib/cache.py
1	1	werkzeug/contrib/iterio.py
1	1	werkzeug/contrib/lint.py
1	1	werkzeug/contrib/securecookie.py
1	1	werkzeug/contrib/testtools.py
1	1	werkzeug/datastructures.py
2	2	werkzeug/debug/__init__.py

commit 99c7956e749aa3268a00177ca0e770957a68825b
Author: Pedro Algarvio <ufs@ufsoft.org>
Date:   2010-10-20 06:34:51 +0100

    Remove port from the Set-Cookie domain attribute.
    Raise RuntimeError when trying to set the domain attribute to something
    local, ie, localhost. In order for cookies to be accepted by complying
    browsers they should be in the form domain.tld, so for localhost, it is
    required to be something like localhost.localdomain or dev.localhost,
    somehting that can be cooked up on the hosts file.
    
    Signed-off-by: Armin Ronacher <armin.ronacher@active-4.com>

1	0	AUTHORS
10	0	werkzeug/utils.py

commit ab3c3bc6f72987f051960393d1f6c5d7bebc84b9
Author: Thomas Waldmann <tw@waldmann-edv.de>
Date:   2010-09-02 14:42:57 +0200

    FileSystemCache: use atomic rename to update cache, fixes concurrency issues
    
    If one read the cache while another process was updating it, reading likely
    failed (and get() returned None due to exception being catched). This can be
    avoided if writing happens to a temporary file which gets atomically renamed
    to the real file afterwards, so the real cache file always has valid/complete
    contents.
    
    Aside from that, this maybe also avoids file sharing problems (esp. on win32).
    
    _list_dir() now filters out potentially left over temporary files (which are
    created in cache directory to avoid crossing filesystem borders).
    
    Note: code was mostly copied from (filesystem based) sessions code, which had
    same issues some time ago, but was already fixed.
    
    added tests for FileSystemCache.set/get

16	0	tests/contrib/test_cache.py
15	3	werkzeug/contrib/cache.py

commit 6ea37cd51e15c44c35770ebaa27ae252fef700d7
Author: Thomas Waldmann <tw@waldmann-edv.de>
Date:   2010-09-02 14:08:39 +0200

    fix FileSystemCache.clear() confusing cache key vs. cache filename
    
    using a new internal method _list_dir() now to get a list of cache filenames
    (absolute filenames). this method will also be used later to filter out
    the temp files we will need when updating the cache using a tempfile and
    a atomic rename.
    
    added a test for FileSystemCache.clear()

15	0	tests/contrib/test_cache.py
13	5	werkzeug/contrib/cache.py

commit 8f1cb158901c4f64fd5e934813fb670c31c0ec2f
Author: Thomas Waldmann <tw@waldmann-edv.de>
Date:   2010-09-02 13:29:42 +0200

    cache: improve docstrings, use open() instead of file()

30	29	werkzeug/contrib/cache.py

commit ec027fe1da90f507cff5585cdee00dcd044a035f
Author: Christopher Grebs <cg@webshox.org>
Date:   2010-07-07 16:10:36 +0200

    added 'allow_subdomain_redirects' option to werkzeug.test.Client.  This allows the test client to redirect to subdomains on the same domain (usefull for multi-subdomain applications), but still not to external targets.  This is an optional feature so we assume the user knows that all his subdomains (at least those get tested) are handled by his application.

commit 088383e4441588ee1113a0e04a1f74e179047455
Author: Armin Ronacher <armin.ronacher@active-4.com>
Date:   2010-04-09 00:48:04 +0200

    `HEAD` is now implicitly added as method in the routing system if
    `GET` is present.  Not doing that was considered a bug because often
    code assumed that this is the case and in web servers that do not
    normalize `HEAD` to `GET` this could break `HEAD` requests.

4	0	CHANGES
13	1	tests/test_routing.py
11	1	werkzeug/routing.py

commit bb654eefcec41dac9da1a0b35503f04b944e7ea9
Author: Armin Ronacher <armin.ronacher@active-4.com>
Date:   2010-04-05 10:44:21 +0200

    heavily improved local objects.  Should pick up standalone greenlet
    builds now and support proxies to free callables as well.  There is
    also a stacked local now that makes it possible to invoke the same
    application from within itself by pushing current request/response
    on top of the stack.
    
    routing build method will also build non-default method rules properly
    if no method is provided.

commit 982c19d5d77491482d7ea463ad58445cd06bb39f
Author: Armin Ronacher <armin.ronacher@active-4.com>
Date:   2010-02-15 17:09:35 +0100

    which means that dates in a broader range can be parsed.  This
    fixes #432.

commit 85396179dac6969af103c426d2eebcd17f9d355e
Author: Christopher Grebs <cg@webshox.org>
Date:   2009-07-19 11:10:30 +0200

    Applied patch for #397
    
    Added tests for and fixed the following issues for #397:
     - POST redirects should be GET and not send data
     - environement messed up on redirect.  The redirect URL was getting put in the base url and the original url was kept
    the same, so the URL when reconstructed after a redirect would have the redirected URL tacked on to the end of the
    original URL.
     - Redirect loops should be an error IMO.  I guess this is debatable, but I went ahead and implimented a solution for
    that and changed the unit tests.

commit b6fcd72b91fd485c8a65ea523b30522b3701b642
Author: Armin Ronacher <armin.ronacher@active-4.com>
Date:   2009-02-24 00:39:09 +0100

    test support was refactored, semi-undocumented `werkzeug.test.File`
    was replaced by :class:`werkzeug.FileStorage`.
    :class:`EnvironBuilder` was added and unifies the previous distinct
    :func:`create_environ`, :class:`Client` and
    :meth:`BaseRequest.from_values`.  They all work the same now which
    is less confusing.

commit fb603da5ec1e4a34ca589f6ca408abf66cc81b5e
Author: Jason Kirtland <jek@discorporate.us>
Date:   2009-01-10 14:19:33 -0800

    - util.Headers is now mostly compatible with the stdlib
      wsgiref.headers.Headers class, with one difference in __getitem__ behavior.
      Passes the stdlib test suite with that exception.
    
    - Added Headers.setdefault().
    
    - Headers.add() accepts keyword parameters for constructing structured header
      values such as 'attachment; filename="foo.bar"'.

commit c153088c6941d29f953cb8dbeb39feb9b73ba16a
Author: Armin Ronacher <armin.ronacher@active-4.com>

commit 0d8ac75f32678a9eabbff7936054e313aef40e86
Author: Alec Thomas <alec@swapoff.org>
Date:   2008-04-03 07:58:49 +0200

    This comments makes the Werkzeug's caching in the SharedDataMiddleware optional.
    
    XHR requests under Firefox do not seem to respect shift-reload (refresh all). This means that any modified static content loaded by Javascript, specifically JS and CSS files, are never reloaded and a full browser restart is required.
